dt: {bc}to cause (a scion) to unite with a stock
{bc}to unite (plants or scion and stock) to form a graft
{bc}to join or unite as if by grafting
{bc}to attach (a chemical unit) to a main molecular chain

shortdef: to cause (a scion) to unite with a stock; also : to unite (plants or scion and stock) to form a graft

dt: {bc}the point of insertion of a scion upon a stock

et: Middle English {it}graffe, grafte{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}greffe, graife{/it} stylus, graph, from Medieval Latin {it}graphium{/it}, from Latin, stylus, from Greek {it}grapheion{/it}, from {it}graphein{/it} to write {ma}{mat|carve|}{/ma}
shortdef: the point of insertion of a scion upon a stock

dt: {bc}the acquisition of gain (such as money) in dishonest or questionable ways

shortdef: the acquisition of gain (such as money) in dishonest or questionable ways; also : illegal or unfair gain

dt: {bc}a surgical procedure performed to shunt blood around a narrowing or blockage in the {d_link|coronary artery|coronary artery} of the heart that usually involves grafting one end of a segment of blood vessel (such as a vein of the leg) removed from another part of the body into the aorta and the other end of the segment into the coronary artery beyond the obstructed area to allow for increased blood flow
often followed by the word {it}surgery{/it} or {it}operation{/it}

dt.t: The artery-dilating procedure, which uses a balloon or other device guided to the restricted artery by a cardiac catheter, is less invasive and traumatic than {wi}coronary artery bypass{/wi} surgery.

dt: When more than one coronary artery or branch is bypassed, the number of times (double, triple, etc.) is often specified.

shortdef: a surgical procedure performed to shunt blood around a narrowing or blockage in the coronary artery of the heart that usually involves grafting one end of a segment of blood vessel (such as a vein of the leg) removed from another part of the body into the aorta and the other end of the segment into the coronary artery beyond the obstructed area to allow for increased blood flow —often followed by the word surgery or operation —abbreviation CABG

dt: {bc}a piece of skin that is surgically removed from a donor area to replace skin in a defective or denuded area (such as one that has been burned)
{bc}the procedure by which such a piece of skin is removed and transferred to a new area

shortdef: a piece of skin that is surgically removed from a donor area to replace skin in a defective or denuded area (such as one that has been burned); also : the procedure by which such a piece of skin is removed and transferred to a new area
